title: core
text:
source



 read_chronicle (dataset:str)

Read a chronicle parquet file into a polars dataframe.




Type
Details




dataset
str
Path to dataset


Returns
DataFrame





z = read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics")
assert type(z) == pl.dataframe.frame.DataFrame

z = read_chronicle("./data/v1/logs")
assert type(z) == pl.dataframe.frame.DataFrame

title: core
text:
Analyse metrics

describe_measures()
The metrics data has a single row for each collected metric.
Use describe() to get a DataFrame of the unique metrics in the metrics data, containaing the service, name and description of each metric.

source


ChronicleMetrics

 ChronicleMetrics (df:polars.dataframe.frame.DataFrame)

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics/").metrics.describe()


get_metric_values()

source



ChronicleMetrics.filter

 ChronicleMetrics.filter (name:str, alias:str)

Extract a single metric from a metrics dataframe




Type
Details




name
str
name of metric to extract


alias
str
alias to use for new column


Returns
DataFrame





read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics/").metrics.filter("rsconnect_system_memory_used", "memory")


Plot metric

source



ChronicleMetrics.plot

 ChronicleMetrics.plot (name:str, alias:str)

Plot a selected metric using a Plotly line plot




Type
Details




name
str
name of metric to extract


alias
str
alias to use for new column


Returns
line





m = read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics/")
p = m.metrics.plot("rsconnect_system_memory_used", "memory")
assert str(type(p)) == "<class 'plotly.graph_objs._figure.Figure'>"

read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics/").metrics.plot("rsconnect_system_memory_used", "memory")

title: core
text:
Analyse logs

source

ChronicleLogs

 ChronicleLogs (df:polars.dataframe.frame.DataFrame)

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

source


ChronicleLogs.filter_type

 ChronicleLogs.filter_type (value:str)

Extract all logs where type == value




Type
Details




value
str
Value to extract


Returns
DataFrame





Filter logs on type

logs = read_chronicle("./data/v1/logs").logs.filter_type("username")
assert type(logs) == pl.DataFrame

# assert logs

polars.dataframe.frame.DataFrame



read_chronicle("./data/v1/logs").logs.filter_type("username")

title: py-chronicle
text:
** Work in progress **
The purpose of this experimental package is to expose functionality to make it easy to read, filter and manipulate chronicle parquet files.

title: py-chronicle
text:
Install
The package is not yet available on PyPi.
#| include: False
pip install py_chronicle
You can install from github:
pip install git+https://github.com/andrie/py-chronicle

title: py-chronicle
text:
How to use

Working with metrics
Some examples.

read_chronicle("./data/v1/metrics").head()
